title: eth_call strict parameter not working as intended

### Description
As a besu blockchain consumer, I want that eth_call strict parameter is working as intended defaulting to false when value is not provided.

Not providing the strict parameter should work as intended as defined in changelog 21.1.0:
https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2110-breaking-changes

The implementation for this parameter was included as part of 21.1.0 as we can see in here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/21.1.0/ethereum/api/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/ethereum/api/jsonrpc/internal/parameters/JsonCallParameter.java

It was working as intended until 21.7.0 version where this code changed:
https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/21.7.0/ethereum/api/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/ethereum/api/jsonrpc/internal/parameters/JsonCallParameter.java

Motivation for this change was this PR https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/2445 but these changes are not working as intended, because not sending the strict parameter is actually working the same as strict: true. 

Only workaround is to actually send the strict: false.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Execute any call without providing strict parameter to eth_call in any version post 21.1.7. Call should be performed with an account that doesnt have any balance.
2. Error returned Upfront cost exceeds account balance from Besu

**Expected behavior:**
Not providing the strict parameter should work as intended as defined in changelog 21.1.0:
https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2110-breaking-changes

**Actual behavior:**
Error returned Upfront cost exceeds account balance from Besu

**Frequency:** 
Always

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: [`besu --version`] Any version > 21.1.7
